preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.traceMinMeters: Minimum distance between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMeters_explaination:
If the value is too low, the track quality may decrease due to GPS imprecision.
A value that is too high also lead to a low-quality track with long straight lines.
Additionally, shorter distances result in more recorded points, which can increase battery consumption.
We recommend setting the value between 5 and 15 meters (approximately 16 to 50 foot) for a good balance.
preferences.traceMinMillis: Minimum time between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMillis_explaination:
To limit the number of recorded points and reduce battery consumption, you can increase the minimum time between each point. Both the minimum time and minimum distance must be met before recording a new point.
We recommend setting it between 2 and 5 seconds.
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays: Number of days a downloaded map is valid
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays_explaination: When you download a map to make it available offline, this setting defines how long it will be retained. It also prevents re-downloading a map if it was recently downloaded, saving time.
preferences.photos_max_pixels_explaination: When you add a photo larger than the maximum size, it will be automatically resized.
preferences.photos_max_quality_explaination: Photos are automatically converted to JPEG format, and this setting determines the compression quality. 100% provides maximum quality with low compression. We recommend setting it around 75% for a good balance of quality and compression.
preferences.photos_max_size_kb_explaination: When you store a photo, the maximum pixel size and quality are applied. If the result is a file size larger than this value, the size and quality will be slightly reduced until the file size is below this threshold.
preferences.photos_cache_explaination: When a photo is displayed, it is downloaded and then cached on your device. This avoids having to download a photo each time, and therefore makes the display faster. It also allows you to view photos offline. So, if you plan to follow a track that contains photos, and you want to be able to view the photos offline during your hike, by viewing the photos before you start the hike while you have network access, they will be available offline.
preferences.thunderforest_explaination: You can add maps from thunderforest.com if you have an account on their web site (a free account is available). Enter your API key below

time_calculation.title: Calculation of hike duration
time_calculation.base_speed_explaination: This speed is used to estimate the hike duration. It is weighted according to the elevation and duration. By default the value is 3.1 mi/h (5 km/h), which corresponds to the average speed of a hiker.
time_calculation.long_break_explaination:
When displaying a hike's duration, we distinguish short stops (to take a break, admire the view, etc.) and long stops (like a picnic).

Short stops are included in the total duration, as it's normal to have brief pauses. However, when a long stop is detected, it's duration is deducted from the hike time so the time shown doesn't depend on how long you took a nap ðŸ˜‰. The deducted time appears in the Breaks section.

To detect long stops, you can configure two parameters: a perimeter and a minimum duration. A stop is considered long when you stay within this perimeter for at least the set minimum time.

donation.title: Contribute
donation.header: Thank you for considering helping this project!
donation.text:
Trailence is free, ad-free, and open-source.

In order to remain so, we would like to ask for your help.

We are transparent about our costs, and what your donations are used for.
  - We currently pay 60 euros per year for hosting (a basic server + the domain name).
  - We have 100GB of storage space for 20 euros.

descriptions.future_costs: Ensure sustainability by covering expenses for 2 additional years
descriptions.increase_capacity: Increase capacity for all users (more storage, server can serve more users)

offline_map.download_trail: Maps corresponding to the track will be downloaded to be available offline
offline_map.download_map: Maps of the currently displayed area will be downloaded to be available offline
offline_map.max_zoom_explaination: The higher you select a zoom level, the more you will be able to zoom during your hike when you are offline, but consequently the longer the download will take and the more storage space will be required on your device.
offline_map.max_zoom_reco: A value between 15 and 17 is recommended. Below 15, the level of detail is often too low to see small paths clearly. Above 17, the download size is large, and is generally not necessary to perfectly follow a route.
offline_map.padding_explaination_for_trail: Percentage of the area to download in around the track area (100% means only the track area). Allows you to see more around the track in offline mode.
offline_map.padding_explaination_for_map: Percentage of the area to download in around the currently displayed area (100% means only the track area). Allows you to see a larger area in offline mode.

obsolete_message.title: Update required
obsolete_message.message: Your application is in an outdated version and needs to be updated. By using this version, your changes cannot be saved to the server and may be lost.

track_edit_tools.title: Edit

slope_threshold.explaination:
Smoothing helps correct GPS inaccuracies, making the trail appear as a continuous slope rather than showing irregular elevation changes.
This is done by:
  • Identifying sections where altitude changes within the configured threshold and distance.
  • Smoothing these sections into a continuous slope while keeping high or low points intact.

selection.title: Selection
selection.select_target_point: Select a point on the map or elevation chart to extend the selection to that point
selection.remove_all_next_points: Remove all points after this one
selection.remove_all_previous_points: Remove all points before this one

tools.back_to_original_track: Back to original trace without improvements

set_elevation_on_range.with_start: Using the one from the first selected point
set_elevation_on_range.with_end: Using the one from the last selected point
set_elevation_on_range.smoothing: By smoothing from the first to the last selected point

tools.apply_default_improvements: Apply default enhancements (those used when creating a trace)

track_edit_tools.no_modification: No changes were made by this function

toast_anonymous_account: When using the app without an account, your data is stored only in your browser and may be automatically deleted if your browser runs out of space. To save and sync your data, you can export it, create an account, and then import it again.
